intro: Amaryllis leucobasis, commonly known as the white amaryllis, is a striking bulbous plant native to South America. It features tall, sturdy stems that produce large, showy flowers in shades of white and pink. The foliage consists of broad, strap-like leaves that are often variegated with white and green patterns. This plant thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is a popular choice for gardens and container planting due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
